intro: Ovidia humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt's ovidia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and requires well-drained soil and full sun. Ovidia humboldtii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
